articles.title: 2 charged in coronavirus prank in suburban Chicago store
articles.description: Police in the Chicago suburb of Joliet say a teen suspected of spraying disinfectant inside a Walmart while announcing that he had the new coronavirus has turned himself

A 19-year-old man suspected of spraying disinfectant inside a Walmart in suburban Chicago while announcing to startled customers that he was infected with the new coronavirus turned himself in to police.

articles.author: MARIA CHENG AP Medical Writer
articles.title: Doctor’s death highlights dangers on front lines of outbreak
articles.description: The death of a Chinese doctor underscores a grim reality: The physicians first to recognize outbreaks are often among the earliest victims. Dr. Li Wenliang's death showed the dangers health workers have faced in similar epidemics, including SARS and Ebola
articles.content:
LONDON -- 
The death of a doctor who issued an early warning about the new virus in China represents a grim reminder that the first health care workers to recognize new outbreaks are sometimes among their earliest victims. 
Dr. Li Wenliang's death underline… [+3993 chars]

articles.title: 11 Americans aboard cruise ship in Japan among those infected with new coronavirus
articles.description: Eleven Americans are among the dozens of people aboard a cruise ship moored in Japan who have tested positive for the novel coronavirus, officials said.
articles.content:
At least 11 Americans are among the dozens of people aboard a cruise ship moored in Japan who have tested positive for the novel coronavirus, officials said.

articles.title: World stock markets retreat after surge on China tariff cut
articles.description: Global stock markets have retreated following a surge driven by a Chinese tariff cut on U.S. imports
articles.content:
Global stock markets retreated Friday as France and Germany reported weak factory data and the death toll from a virus outbreak in China rose further.
